website_summaries.verdict: A more expensive and complex model that shares some desirable features with its lower-priced counterparts.
pros: Easy-attach sleeve arm makes tasks easier

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, I love the integrated sleeve board. I pressed 14 pairs of trousers in 30 minutes to test it out. I agree with a previous review that you have to hang on to the handle when you open it or it jumps up on the table. Also, that the opening is tight when positioning clothes towards the back - I burned my knuckles.
customer_reviews.author: Philip D. McGaughey

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to heat up. I mean like 20 minutes or more. I turn it on and do other things around house. Cannot get steam to work, Also hard to hold garment on surface - keeps sliding off.
customer_reviews.author: DC775

customer_reviews.title: Practice makes it perfect
customer_reviews.text: I liked it a lot...just need practice especially with sleeve attachment. Makes quick work of pants
customer_reviews.author: MRST

customer_reviews.title: Should be consider a necessary appliance for individual with pain issues.
customer_reviews.text: Makes the chore of pressing the clothes a breeze especially the little ones. Had two of these when my children was in school. The first did not burn out for over 5 years and I found another one. It was broken by family members. It was an accident but realizing that I could not find another presser made it a disaster. The children is gone but due to medical conditions, I do not like to stand a lot because of pain issues and this appliance helps prevent long periods of getting this task done.
customer_reviews.author: Astonia

customer_reviews.title: Good device, too small
customer_reviews.text: It is a good machine and the finished product looked great. I sent it back because it is just too small so getting the results you want takes as long as ironing if not longer... but if that is okay with you, you are going to want to buy a stand to ensure your garments to not hang on the floor or table
customer_reviews.author: casual User

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I would love to have a little bit larger pillow that is used to iron pleats and gathers, but over all this machine is wonderful! It sure has saved my poor old elbows from having to keep pushing that iron around. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazing...

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with this product. Cuts my overall time to press my cloths and the results are much better than using an Iron. I would purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service if you need it too
customer_reviews.text: Works good use it for my tuxedos I’m a chauffeur it saves me a lot of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Michele K.

customer_reviews.title: For Wranglers and Western Shirts it is impossible to get a heavy starch because of the quick cool down safety feature
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get this home. We are not inpressed with it at all. For Wranglers and Western Shirts it is impossible to get a heavy starch because of the quick cool down safety feature. It drops the temp within 5 seconds of closing. And it is impossible to press the yoke of the shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!!!! I had a little problem getting the press hot enough and staying hot to press cotton shirts and shorts then I started keeping the press on the " linen" and its the perfect setting for cotton I can press shirts in less than a minuet!!! I now press T shirts and everything Its amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.author: patrick  Parker

customer_reviews.title: It came in with nonfunctioning digital reader. It take ...
customer_reviews.text: It came in with nonfunctioning digital reader. It take too long to heat Como to a regular handheld iron. It may save a little time if you are doing more that one item, however I did not think it was worth the price for my intent.
customer_reviews.author: B. T.

customer_reviews.title: Package delivered as promised on said date.
customer_reviews.text: Package delivered as promised on said date. Tried it today and did not see the steam I expected to see so I will have to see I'm not using it the right way
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Mayorga

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it. I read from the reviews before I ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it. I read from the reviews before I purchased this item, that once you hit the steam burst it takes a while to get back to the desired temperature. However this is true but you can still continue to press your clothing because the presser is still hot and it does not take long to get back to the set temperature. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LilDivaLill

customer_reviews.title: This is a great presser, A little slow on heating up
customer_reviews.text: This is a great presser, A little slow on heating up, but once it is hot it does a great job and very easy to use. I have used other brands of pressers, but this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am completely satisfied with my speedy press machine.
customer_reviews.text: Speedy Press i found to be as advertised,its much quicker than conventional ironing,with lots of easy accessible options i wish we had gotten it long ago,we also love the fact that you need to sit while ironing,I strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hilton M Edmund

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to press demin pants that are wrinkled from the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to press demin pants that are wrinkled from the dryer. It is a good investment ..It save on the cleaning bill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lov it. working on quilts is so much speedier ...
customer_reviews.text: Lov it. working on quilts is so much speedier now with the large area that presses all at the same time. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Firestone

customer_reviews.title: This is a great ironing tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ironing tool. In the beginning, being that I was not familiar with using it I did not like it too much but once I got used to using it I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ransom Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Short life, Complete Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Although perfect for small/simple pieces such as t shirts or tops, bulky pieces with zippers or pockets just couldn't be handled. Most importantly, it only lasted a month and a half. Was ironing a basic pair of linen slacks and started losing temperature. Within a few minutes, wouldn't heat above 102 degrees. Complete Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.author: Sally A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not a time-saver.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 star rating is mostly based on the amount of time it takes to finish a garment. You have to figure in time for: waiting for the press to reheat, carefully arranging fabric to prevent burns, dealing with accidental creases--which are a nightmare to get out. Additionally, all LCD displays are only in Metric. Frustrating. Also, this is not a time saver at all! I suppose it might be a money saver since it reduces trips to the dry cleaner. However, I'm at the point that a trip to the dry cleaner is better for my nerves.
customer_reviews.author: BrianV

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter in law bought me this for my birthday. The best gift for me due to the fact that I wear professional attire almost every day. I can use this sitting down and the machine does all the work for me! I've had it a few weeks and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Saffer

customer_reviews.title: what a great gift,
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from arthritis and therefore ironing has become a painful chore. This product that I received as a gift from my grandson is an absolute lifesaver. I can continue wearing my crisp starched shirts with minimal effort that is pain free. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ik

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it as part of her Christmas gift and we love it!
customer_reviews.text: My Wife has been wanting a steam press for quite a while. She saw this on Amazon. Wanted it as part of her Christmas gift and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Z.

product_meta.title: Digital Steam Press with Integrated Sleeveboard 25.6 Inches, 1400 Watt, 100 lbs of Pressure 38 Powerful Jets of Steam, Includes Replacement Pad
product_meta.description: Fed up of Ironing? Don't waste another minute! Ironing chores are now a thing of the past with an Ironing Press. You'll be able to use it either as a Dry Press or as a Steam Press with its convenient and easy-to-use controls, and non-stick cover. It can be used with or without steam, with pressure equivalent to 100lbs effortless burst of steam for stubborn creases. It has a built-in water reservoir and a large opening area, and variable temperature from 100 to 210 degrees for different fabrics. NO WONDER SPEEDY PRESS HAS SOLD THOUSANDS OF PRESSES IN EUROPE!!
feature_bullets: Quick to set up on any table or work area, with easy-to-use simple controls. Easy-to-use integrated Sleeve Arm.
Reduces Ironing Time Considerably and it is suitable for delicate fabrics, with temperature controls for different fabrics.
10 times the size of an iron at 25.6inches x 9.5inches, 1400 watt, lightweight: only 27.5lbs!
This model can be used Dry or using Steam settings with a burst setting that will remove stubborn wrinkles.
Large Opening area. This model provides equivalent of 100 lbs of even pressure.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars30 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
